result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Hurtado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for Good Time Credit. Defendant is not eligible for Huber. Sentence to commence forthwith.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Hurtado

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 16CF51 & 22CF30 Cases called @ 10:30 AM Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Mark A. Hurtado. 22CF30 - Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1, 2 & 3 - NC. Judge makes a statement on the record regarding the defendant's position and his plea.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 4, 5, 6 & 7 - DRI.  16CF51 - Motion to Vacate PPDA filed by the State. Defendant does not contest that a violation has occurred. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. The Court finds that there has been a material breech of the agreement, sets the agreement aside and enters JOC on Count 2. No statement by DE. Court orders: 16CF51 - 9 mos WC Jail - No Huber, GT, 199 days CFTS, sentence to commence forthwith, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. 22CF30 - S/W 4 years probation - Conditions: Pay all restitution as articulated in the criminal complaint for child support obligations, Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments of $577 per month as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 09FA62, DE to begin making those payments by no later than September 1, 2022,  Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $6200 Extradition Fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Mark A. Hurtado. Atty Rae requests P/S Hearing.
Inmate request to Court for Writ of Habeas Corpus - DE has counsel so all inquiries need to come through attorney
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Cases 22CF30 & 16CF51 called @ 2:12 PM: Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Mark A. Hurtado. 22CF30 Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Court entertains waiver of preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause exists. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NGP entered on all 7 counts. 22CF30 & 16CF51 STC Scheduled - NOH Given.
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
In Waushara Co. Jail

Case called @ 09:22 AM Defendant Mark A. Hurtado not in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears telephonically. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the Continental US. The Court tolls any applicable time limits that relate to the Post Plea Diversion Agreement pending execution of the warrant.
Motion hearing on May 25, 2021 at 09:15 am.
State's Motion to Vacate PPDA

Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 9/15/2018 - Request Denied
Jail inmate request
Post Plea Diversion Agreement- 4 years

8:39 am case called-16CF61, 17CF244, & 18CM338. Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 16CF51-No Contest to Count 2, 17CF244-No Contest to Count 3 & Count 4. 18CM338-No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads in Count 1 of 16CF51, Count 1 & 2 of 17CF244 & Count 2 of 18CM338.  16CF51-Court withholds JOC and accepts terms of PPDA for a period of 4 years. Bond modified to $5,000 Signature Bond. Court admonishes the defendant regarding conditions of bond and potential consequences if violated. Statement by defendant. 18CM338-60 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Weapon to be destroyed. 17CF244-SWD and places on probation for a period of 4 years. CONDITIONS: COUNT 3 ONLY- 6 months WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. Credit for 83 days served. Consecutive to 18CM338. CONDITIONS ON BOTH COUNTS: Payment of Child Support as ordered in Waushara County 09FA62. Full-time gainful Employment. Terms of Agent. Costs to include Extradition fees of $2,667.00, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.

10:30 am cases called-16CF51,17CF244 & 18CM338.  Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court questions counsel regarding status of matters. 18CM338-  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   PLEAS Scheduled - NOH Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2018 at 10:30 am.

9:30 am cases called-16CF51 & 17CF244.  Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in custody.  Karen L. Marone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated on each case - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Statement by Attorney Patzer regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Patzer confirms receipt of both informations, waives formal reading and enters a Not Guilty plea to all charges.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Bond modification requested by Attorney Patzer. Court respectfully declines to modify bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Updated Statement by A. Bise
Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 7/2/2018

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on July 13, 2018 at 09:30 am.
BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 16CF-51 AND 17CF-244.  Defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant and SPD

16CF-51 and 17CF-244 - Both Cases Called @ 1:07 PM: Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant Mark A. Hurtado in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  DA confirms extradition from the State of Texas.  DA argues as to bond request of $20000 cash w/conditions.  Argument as to bond by SPD - argues for $2000 Signature Bond - ties to the community exist and he could obtain local employment.  The Court:  Orders single bond as to both cases of $15000.00 w/condition on leaving the State of WI.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2018 at 09:30 am.
In WC Jail
Per information from WCSD (Nancy Maas):  Mark Hurtado has been detained in Bexar Co Jail, State of Texas.  Extradition proceedings being undertaken.
